summary: Many U.S. technologies rely on imported critical minerals, like cobalt and lithium. Disruptions in the global mineral supply chain could seriously affect U.S. energy production, aviation, and other industries. Federal agencies created a national strategy to ensure reliable and secure supplies of 35 critical minerals. Finding ways to recycle these minerals or develop alternatives to them ("recovery and substitution") is a key piece of the...
title: Critical Minerals: Building on Federal Efforts to Advance Recovery and Substitution Could Help Address Supply Risks
